item.title: Version 1.4
item.description:
# ClaudeSettings 1.4 Release Notes

Features

  • Expanded Settings Interface: The "Add Setting" interface now displays all available Claude Code settings, making it easier to discover and configure options you may not have known existed.
  • Project-Local Default: New settings now default to project-local scope, keeping your global configuration clean and making per-project customization the natural choice.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed Dictionary Merge: Resolved an issue where dictionary-type settings weren't being merged correctly when adding new values.
  • Fixed Test Reliability: Corrected test assertions to properly reflect the expected behavior of file type availability based on the current view context.

item.title: Version 1.3
item.description:
# ClaudeSettings 1.3 Release Notes

Features

Automatic Updates

ClaudeSettings now includes built-in auto-update functionality. The app will automatically check for new versions and notify you when updates are available, making it easier to stay current with the latest features and improvements.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed an issue that could occur with release builds

item.title: Version 1.2
item.description:
# ClaudeSettings 1.2 Release Notes

Features

Auto-Update Support

ClaudeSettings now checks for and installs updates automatically using GitHub releases. You'll be notified when new versions are available and can update with a single click.

Add New Settings

You can now add new configuration properties directly within the app. The interface uses JSON schema validation to ensure your settings are correctly formatted.

Hide Global Configuration Properties

A new toggle allows you to hide global settings from view, making it easier to focus on project-specific configurations when needed.

Improvements

Improved Installation Package

The release distribution now uses `create-dmg` for a more polished installation experience.

Bug Fixes

Fixed Hide Global Settings Toggle

Resolved an issue where toggling the "Hide Global Settings" option wouldn't immediately update the view.
